ygData.subject: Re: Laughing at Striker
ygData.msgSnippet: Uh, Minime, Striker never spoke any commands to his computer outloud. It was all done internally and silently. ... Striker s eyes narrow as he looks at Prebon,

Uh, Minime, Striker never spoke any commands to his computer outloud. It was 
all done internally and silently.

::Striker::

Striker's eyes narrow as he looks at Prebon, wondering what Prebon was 
talking about. He hadn't said a word aloud to his computer. He frowns at 
Prebon's threat about Spears, almost having second thoughts about his plans.

But Prebon wouldn't kill Spears, he was almost sure of that. If Prebon killed 
Spears, then either Striker or Prebon would also die, probably in a duel. 
Then, either Prebon would have no hostages and the Maximals will be free to 
attack and crush, or he'd be dead. Either way, he loses.

Activating his link again, he sends all that his scanners had worked out 
about the chip to the CF, looking at Prebon through the rectangular hole in 
the door. With another silent command, his emotion circuits go offline. 
Prebon might make some very personal threats, Striker couldn't afford to go 
weak. Besides, he was sure Prebon wouldn't kill his hostages.

"If you kill Spears, you'll have no hostages," Striker says, in a calm voice, 
surprizingly devoid of emotion, "The Maximals would be free to crush you. And 
as the biggest faction on the planet, they wouldn't have any trouble doing 
so. If you free Spears and let us go, I can bring you Ramulus."
